title: 1553-F
statement: F. Pairwise Modulotime limit per test4 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou have an array $$$a$$$ consisting of $$$n$$$ distinct positive integers, numbered from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$. Define $$$p_k$$$ as $$$$$$p_k = \\sum_{1 \\le i, j \\le k} a_i \\bmod a_j,$$$$$$ where $$$x \\bmod y$$$ denotes the remainder when $$$x$$$ is divided by $$$y$$$. You have to find and print $$$p_1, p_2, \\ldots, p_n$$$.InputThe first line contains $$$n$$$ â€” the length of the array ($$$2 \\le n \\le 2 \\cdot 10^5$$$).The second line contains $$$n$$$ space-separated distinct integers $$$a_1, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 3 \\cdot 10^5$$$, $$$a_i \\neq a_j$$$ if $$$i \\neq j$$$).OutputPrint $$$n$$$ integers $$$p_1, p_2, \\ldots, p_n$$$.ExamplesInput4 6 2 7 3Output0 2 12 22Input3 3 2 1Output0 3 5
